intro: Kielmeyera speciosa var. major, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by spherical, yellow fruits. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a dense canopy. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in musical instrument making, it is considered a valuable but threatened species.
